description:
doc: give up on OS X Leopard

Fixes issue 3206.

messages.text:
Hello golang-dev@googlegroups.com,

I'd like you to review this change to
https://go.googlecode.com/hg/

FYI

http://codereview.appspot.com/5769046/diff/2002/doc/install.html
File doc/install.html (right):

http://codereview.appspot.com/5769046/diff/2002/doc/install.html#newcode38
doc/install.html:38: for the FreeBSD, Linux, Mac OS X (Snow Leopard/Lion), and Windows operating systems
considering that new cat is coming out soon, would it be better to say 10.6+ or something here, rather than confining it to exactly two releases?

On Wed, Mar 7, 2012 at 12:20,  <bradfitz@golang.org> wrote:
> Leopard/Lion), and Windows operating systems
> considering that new cat is coming out soon, would it be better to say
> 10.6+ or something here, rather than confining it to exactly two
> releases?

I can't keep the version numbers straight.
It doesn't help that Apple doesn't promote them
and uname -a prints similar-looking but unrelated
numbers.

"Snow Leopard and newer" ?

On Wed, Mar 7, 2012 at 10:45 AM, Russ Cox <rsc@golang.org> wrote:

> On Wed, Mar 7, 2012 at 12:20,  <bradfitz@golang.org> wrote:
> > Leopard/Lion), and Windows operating systems
> > considering that new cat is coming out soon, would it be better to say
> > 10.6+ or something here, rather than confining it to exactly two
> > releases?
>
> I can't keep the version numbers straight.
>

Funny. I can't keep the cats straights.


> It doesn't help that Apple doesn't promote them
> and uname -a prints similar-looking but unrelated
> numbers.
>
> "Snow Leopard and newer" ?


"Snow Leopard (10.6) and newer"

>> On Wed, Mar 7, 2012 at 12:20,  <bradfitz@golang.org> wrote:
>> > Leopard/Lion), and Windows operating systems
>> > considering that new cat is coming out soon, would it be better to say
>> > 10.6+ or something here, rather than confining it to exactly two
>> > releases?
>>
>> I can't keep the version numbers straight.
>
>
> Funny. I can't keep the cats straights.

Well there's that problem too.  Snow Leopard/Lion seems fine.
We can add Mountain Lion once it stops being a moving target.

Russ

On Wed, Mar 7, 2012 at 10:55 AM, Brad Fitzpatrick <bradfitz@golang.org>wrote:

> On Wed, Mar 7, 2012 at 10:45 AM, Russ Cox <rsc@golang.org> wrote:
>
>> On Wed, Mar 7, 2012 at 12:20,  <bradfitz@golang.org> wrote:
>> > Leopard/Lion), and Windows operating systems
>> > considering that new cat is coming out soon, would it be better to say
>> > 10.6+ or something here, rather than confining it to exactly two
>> > releases?
>>
>> I can't keep the version numbers straight.
>>
>
> Funny. I can't keep the cats straights.
>
>
>> It doesn't help that Apple doesn't promote them
>> and uname -a prints similar-looking but unrelated
>> numbers.
>>
>> "Snow Leopard and newer" ?
>
>
> "Snow Leopard (10.6) and newer"
>

oh, we're already in a parenthetical.  your text is fine.  I'm just a bad
Mac user.

LGTM

*** Submitted as http://code.google.com/p/go/source/detail?r=7f80efcdc862 ***

doc: give up on OS X Leopard

Fixes issue 3206.

R=golang-dev, gri, bradfitz
CC=golang-dev
http://codereview.appspot.com/5769046

subject: code review 5769046: doc: give up on OS X Leopard
